page.title: 18Organisations in Codsall
page.content: 2087 (Boscobel) Squadron of the Air Training Corps was formed in 1942 and was based at a local Codsall school. The Squadron has since moved into its own building in Wood Road. Girls were introduced into the Squadron about two years ago and we now boast the highest number of female cadets in the Staffs. Wing. One of the main Squadron events is the Boscobel Walk. This is an annual event commemorating the hiding of King Charles in the Boscobel Oak. Many participants raise money for charity by organising sponsorship schemes. Several hundred people usually take part. Codsall and Bilbrook Red Cross has over 80 members. Its function is to train its members and the public in First Aid, Nursing and Red Cross skills. As we rely on donations from the public, fundraising also forms part of our activities.
